prompt: <description>**CAD Model Generation Instructions** The final shape to be constructed is a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a stylized hammer or mallet. The cylinder is wider at the bottom and narrows towards the top, which is pointed. The object is centered and appears to be floating in space. This will be achieved through the construction of three intermediate parts. **Part 1** Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.4181]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle with center at [0.1659, 0.1659] and radius of 0.1659. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3319. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.3319 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal to create the 3D model. **Part 2** Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a reflective material. The object is centered and occupies a significant portion of the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.1228, 0.1228, 0.4181]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle with center at [0.0431, 0.0431] and radius of 0.0431. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0863. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.3319 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal to create the 3D model. 7. Join the current part with the previous part using the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation. **Part 3** Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The object has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a reflective material. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and translation vector of [0.1229, 0.209, 0.0863]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle with center at [0.043, 0.043] and radius of 0.043. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0861. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.0863 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal to create the 3D model. 7. Join the current part with the previous part using the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation. The resulting CAD model will match the final shape description provided.</description>

<description>**Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** *Shape*: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one of its faces. *Dimensions*: length - 0.75, width - 0.75, height - 0.0938 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. No need to change the euler angles and translation vector, as they are already set to 0.0. **2D Sketch on Face 1:** 1. **Draw Line 1** from point (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). 2. **Draw Line 2** from point (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.25). 3. **Draw Line 3** from point (0.75, 0.25) to (0.0, 0.25). 4. **Draw Line 4** from point (0.0, 0.25) to (0.0, 0.0), closing the loop to create the rectangular prism's base. **Create the following loops on Face 1:** 1. **Loop 1** consists of 4 lines, as specified above. 2. **Loop 2** consists of a single circle, with a center at (0.125, 0.125) and a radius of 0.0312. 3. **Loop 3** consists of a single circle, with a center at (0.625, 0.125) and a radius of 0.0312. **3D Sketch Transformation:** 1. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75 along all axes using the 'sketch_scale' parameter. 2. **Transfrom the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** using the euler angles and translation vector provided. **Extrusion:** 1. **Extrude the 2D sketch** 0.0938 units in the positive Z direction (towards the normal). 2. **Do not extrude the sketch** in the negative Z direction (opposite to the normal). **Operation:** *Details*: A new solid body is created, and no boolean operations are required with preceding CAD models. Remember to double-check the geometry and dimensions while working on this part, and if necessary, you can always fine-tune the small details. Upon completing this part, you can then proceed to create the next part(s) as required by the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

</json>

The model is centered and isolated against a white background. **Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation, as indicated by the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). **Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch scaling parameter is 0.75. The final dimensions of this part are 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.4615 units in height.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: A rectangular prism with two circular holes on opposite sides** 1. Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector of [0.0, 0.225, 0.0]. 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the new coordinate system. 3. Draw the following: - A line from point [0.15, 0.0] to point [0.6, 0.0]. - An arc with a start point at [0.6, 0.0], mid point at [0.75, 0.15], and end point at [0.6, 0.3]. - A line from point [0.6, 0.3] to point [0.15, 0.3]. - An arc with a start point at [0.15, 0.3], mid point at [0.0, 0.15], and end point at [0.15, 0.0]. 4. Create three loops in the sketch: - Loop 1: A rectangle defined by the four lines. - Loop 2: A circle centered at [0.15, 0.15] with a radius of 0.075. - Loop 3: A circle centered at [0.6, 0.15] with a radius of 0.075. 5. Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch, creating a 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.075 and an extrusion depth opposite normal of 0.0. **Part 2: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector of [0.525, 0.225, 0.075]. 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the new coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle with a center at [0.075, 0.075] and a radius of 0.075. 4. Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.15. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch, creating a 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.225 and an extrusion depth opposite normal of 0.0. **Part 3: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a stylized cone** 1. Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector of [0.075, 0.225, 0.075]. 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the new coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle with a center at [0.075, 0.075] and a radius of 0.075. 4. Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.15. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch, creating a 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0 and an extrusion depth opposite normal of 0.15. The final shape is a 3D model of a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, connected to a cylindrical tube at one end. It is made up of three parts: a rectangular prism with two circular holes on opposite sides, a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom, and a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a stylized cone. The dimensions are as follows: - Part 1: length - 0.75, width - 0.075, height - 0.75 - Part 2: length - 0.15, width - 0.225, height - 0.15 - Part 3: length - 0.15, width - 0.15, height - 0.15</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with uniformly spaced indentations** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.2045, 0.2045, 0.2045] Next, create the first face of the sketch using the following line segments to form a loop: 1. line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.3409, 0.0] 2. line_2: [0.3409, 0.0] to [0.3409, 0.0682] 3. line_3: [0.3409, 0.0682] to [0.2727, 0.0682] 4. line_4: [0.2727, 0.0682] to [0.2727, 0.1364] 5. line_5: [0.2727, 0.1364] to [0.2045, 0.1364] 6. line_6: [0.2045, 0.1364] to [0.2045, 0.2045] 7. line_7: [0.2045, 0.2045] to [0.1364, 0.2045] 8. line_8: [0.1364, 0.2045] to [0.1364, 0.2727] 9. line_9: [0.1364, 0.2727] to [0.0682, 0.2727] 10. line_10: [0.0682, 0.2727] to [0.0682, 0.3175] 11. line_11: [0.0682, 0.3175] to [0.0682, 0.3409] 12. line_12: [0.0682, 0.3409] to [0.0, 0.3409] 13. line_13: [0.0, 0.3409] to [0.0, 0.0] Create the second face with the same loop definition as the first face. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the following rotation and translation parameters: * Scaling: 0.3409 * Rotation: Euler Angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation: [0.2045, 0.2045, 0.2045] Extrude the 3D sketch using the following properties: * Extrusion depth towards the normal: 0.1364 * Extrusion depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Operation: Create a new solid body **Dimensions of the Part** This part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.3409 (120.073 mm) * Width: 0.1364 (49.355 mm) * Height: 0.3409 (120.073â€‹ mm) The uniformly spaced indentations have a depth of 0.1364 (49.355 mm).</description>
